page.title: 02MAIN FEATURES OF THE AREA
page.content:
The valley formed by the{Dulas Brook is narrower with steep sides. Connecting these two valleys is a high plateau called{Ewyas Harold Common.
There is a{castle tump}on a high bit of land just outside Ewyas Harold. The castle ,which is no longer there,was of Motte and Bailey construction and was the first{Norman castle}built in this country after the invasion.
There is a very old{Abbey church called{Dore Abbey}dating back to the 12th century.{Abbey Dore Village}is named after it. There is also an old Manor called{Abbey Dore Court.
At Dulas there is a small church and the Manor House is called{Dulas Court. In Ewyas Harold there is an old church by the Dulas Brook.
